Of course, these senatusconsulta were merely a disguised form of imperial constitution. The sovereigirty had in fact passed from both patriciana and plebeians to the hands of the princeps. A measure was recommended by the emperor in an oratio or epistola to the senate, and then proposed by the consul who convoked the senate, and voted by the senate without opposi- tion. Hence a senatusconsult is sometimes called oratio, s. g. oratio divi Marci, Dig. 2, 12, 1 pr. Even this form was finally disused.
